parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> ofp

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game2</name>=<value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>version2</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game3</name>=<value> arma2

</value></part><part><name>version3</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game4</name>=<value> arma2oa

</value></part><part><name>version4</name>=<value> 1.51

</value></part><part><name>game5</name>=<value> tkoh

</value></part><part><name>version5</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game6</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version6</name>=<value> 0.50

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Inventory

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Adds a magazine to a person. Infantry units can only carry a specific number of magazines, once the magazine slots are filled (or uniform/vest/bagpack are full in <template><title>arma3</title></template>), any further [[addMagazine]] commands are ignored. If class of magazine does not exist, an error message is printed in .rpt:
<code>[[player]] [[addMagazine]] "dasdsa"; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>.rpt: Given magazine[dasdsa] not found)</value></part></template></code>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Use [[addMagazine]] ''before'' [[addWeapon]] for the weapon to be loaded with magazine automatically.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> unitName [[addMagazine]] magazineName

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]] - person to add the magazines to

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> magazineName: [[String]] - magazine name. See the topic [[:Category:Weapons]] for reference about possible values.

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> unitName [[addMagazine]] [magazineName, ammoCount]<br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma2oa</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.62</value></part></template> <template><title>Icon</title><part><name index="1"/><value>localArgument</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>32</value></part></template><template><title>Icon</title><part><name index="1"/><value>globalEffect</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>32</value></part></template><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part></template> <template><title>Icon</title><part><name index="1"/><value>globalArgument</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>32</value></part></template><template><title>Icon</title><part><name index="1"/><value>globalEffect</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>32</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]] - person to add the magazines to

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> magazineName: [[String]] - magazine name. See the topic [[:Category:Weapons]] for reference about possible values.

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> ammoCount: [[Number]] - Ammo quantity to be added to magazine. If it goes beyond maximum magazine capacity, the magazine will be given full and not overloaded.

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[addMagazine]] "30Rnd_556x45_STANAG";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[addMagazine]] ["30Rnd_556x45_STANAG", 15]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>since Arma 2 OA 1.62</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>nonLocalUnit [[addMagazine]] ["30Rnd_556x45_STANAG", 15]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>global argument since Arma 3</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[addMagazine]] ["30Rnd_556x45_STANAG", 9999]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>will give a 30 rounds magazine anyway</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[addMagazineGlobal]], [[addMagazines]], [[addMagazineCargo]], [[addMagazineCargoGlobal]], [[addMagazinePool]], [[addMagazineTurret]], [[removeMagazine]], [[removeMagazines]], [[addWeapon]], [[loadMagazine]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 2, 2006 - 06:59</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Hoz|Hoz]]</dt>
<dd class="note">If the unit has magazines already, you may need to use the commands [[removeMagazine]] or [[removeMagazines]] to make space for the mags you want to add.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 21, 2010 - 20:13</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Vigilante|Vigilante]]</dt>
<dd class="note">In turreted vehicles the magazine is added to the first turret with >> primaryGunner = 1; << set in the Vehicles turret config part (and the magazine is ONLY added to the very first turret if more than one is configged with >> primaryGunner = 1; << ).

<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 12, 2010 - 20:09</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Inkompetent|Inkompetent]]</dt>
<dd class="note">When wanting to add many magazines to an object's init-line it can be easier to use loops than to just repeat the addMagazine command.

If you want to add N magazines to an object either of the two below ways are handy, the first for fewer magazines, and the latter when you want to add many since it then is the easiest of the two to read.
<code>{this [[addMagazine]] "magazineClassName"} [[forEach]] [1,2,3,...,N];
[[for]] "_i" [[from]] 0 [[to]] (N - 1) [[do]] {this [[addMagazine]] "magazineClassName"};</code>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 28, 2017 - 13:10 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Pisces_72|Pisces_72]]</dt>
<dd class="note">If adding a magazine to an empty artillery support with this command in Arma 3, use [[reload]]. If you do not reload, Artillery calls will not fire rounds, because the AI won't reload automatically (tested with 82mm mortar)

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
